Class DeviceAtlas
In: lib/device_atlas.rb
Parent: Object

JSON is a required rependency 

    sudo gem install JSON

Used to load the recognition tree and perform lookups of all properties, or individual properties. Typical usage is as follows: 

    device_atlas = DeviceAtlas.new
    tree = device_atlas.getTreeFromFile("sample/DeviceAtlas.json")
    properties = device_atlas.getProperties(tree, "Nokia6680...")
    property = device_atlas.getProperty(tree, "Nokia6680...", "displayWidth")

Note that you should normally use the user-agent that was received in the device‘s HTTP request. In a Rails environment, you would do this as follows: 

    user_agent = request.env['HTTP_USER_AGENT']
    display_width = device_atlas.getPropertyAsInteger(tree, user_agent, "displayWidth")
Author:MTLD (dotMobi)

Public Instance methods

getApiRevision()

Returns the revision number of this API

getProperties(tree, userAgent)

Returns an array of known properties (as strings) for the user agent

getPropertiesAsTyped(tree, userAgent)

Returns an array of known properties (as typed) for the user agent

getProperty(tree, userAgent, property)

Returns a value for the named property for this user agent

getPropertyAsBoolean(tree, userAgent, property)

Strongly typed property accessor. Returns a boolean property. (Throws an exception if the property is actually of another type.)

getPropertyAsDate(tree, userAgent, property)

Strongly typed property accessor. Returns a date property. (Throws an exception if the property is actually of another type.)

getPropertyAsInteger(tree, userAgent, property)

Strongly typed property accessor. Returns an integer property. (Throws an exception if the property is actually of another type.)

getPropertyAsString(tree, userAgent, property)

Strongly typed property accessor. Returns a string property. (Throws an exception if the property is actually of another type.)

getTreeFromFile(filename)

Returns a tree from a JSON file. Use an absolute path name to be sure of success if the current working directory is not clear.

getTreeFromString(string)

Returns a tree from a JSON string

getTreeRevision(tree)

Returns the revision number of the tree

listProperties(tree)

Returns an array of known property names. Returns all properties available for all user agents in this tree, with their data type names

Protected Instance methods

_getProperties(tree, userAgent, typedValues)

Returns an array of known properties for the user agent. Allows the values of properties to be forced to be strings.

_getProperty(tree, userAgent, property, typedValue)

Returns a value for the named property for this user agent. Allows the value to be typed or forced as a string.

_getRevisionFromKeyword(keyword)

Formats the SVN revision string to return a number

_idFromProperty(tree, property)

Return the coded ID for a property‘s name

_propertyFromId(tree, id)

Return the name for a property‘s coded ID

_propertyTypeCheck(tree, property, prefix, typeName)

Checks that the property is of the supplied type or throws an error.

_seekProperties(node, string, properties, sought, matched)

Seek properties for a user agent within a node. This is designed to be recursed, and only externally called with the node representing the top of the tree

_valueAsTypedFromId(tree, id, propertyId)

Returns the property value as typed

_valueFromId(tree, id)

Return the value for a value‘s coded ID

[Validate]
